node.title: recruiting api 및 문제별 채점 상태 로직 추가

nodes.bodyText: @shp7724 PR이 너무 커지는 것 같기도 하고.. 원래 리크루팅 api만 추가하려다가 도저히 못 참겠어서 여기저기 건드렸는데 일단 머지하고 고쳐야될 부분들 정리해서 리팩토링 PR을 파는 방향으로 가겠음다

e2df61a
이게 내가 할 수 있는 최선이었다 ㅠ
맘에 안 들면 나중에 고치자

node.bodyText: 고생했어 👍

PENDING 같은건 없어도 되나요?
큐 들어가기 전 상태

근데 사실.. 이거 .merge 안해도 self.transaction exit하면서 flush 되더라
그래도 명시적으로 .merge 넣는게 낫겠지?
Problem에 language 필드는 왜 있는건가요?

갠취로 TokenStr = str 이런식으로 typealias 걸어주는것도 좋다구 생각
꼭 반영은 안해도 됨
is_example일떄는 submission이 None이야? 먼가 이상한듯
submission 인자로 None이 들어올 수 있는게 이상한거같아

case _ 대신 명확하게 적어주면 좋을듯?
그리고 테케 하나라도 틀리면 WRONG 으로 하기로 햇던가?

나도 비슷한거 추가했는데..
resume에 있다가 recruiting 폴더로 옮긴것들 컨플릭 잘 해결해야겠네
와.. 이게 의도가 뭐야?

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
            v1_router = APIRouter(prefix="/v1/recruiting", tags=["recruiting"])
          
          
            
            v1_router = APIRouter(prefix="/v1/recruitings", tags=["recruitings"])
          
      
    
    
  

복수형으로 쓰는 걸 더 자주 본듯 한데..
https://chat.openai.com/share/8fe235b6-d9f6-4845-9a1a-6c755516afc1

저도 그거 고민했는데 클라 입장에서 둘을 구분할 필요가 있을까 싶어서 뺐어요
피그마 보시면 미제출이랑 채점중, 성공, 실패만 구분해서요

오 그래??
근데 너말대로 명시적으로 merge 넣어주는 게 좋을듯

이거 Problem이 아니라 CodeSubmission임
가장 최근 제출 불러올 때 어떤 언어로 작성했는지도 불러와야할 것 같아서 넣었어 (클라에서 언어별로 코드 하이라이트를 다르게 해준다던가 하는 식으로 쓸 수 있으니까)
아 ㅋㅋㅋ 깜빡 속았네
넹 좋아여

ㄴㄴ 좋은 생각인듯
cd1ed88
근데 이번 플젝하면서 느낀건데 우리도 Pn룰 적용했으면 어땠을까 싶다

is_example 일 때는 디비에 저장을 따로 안 하려고 했는데
음... self.session.execute 만 안 하고 submission은 똑같이 있는 게 좋으려나?

위에랑 같은 이슈군
한 번 고쳐볼게

운영팀이랑 어제 회의한 걸로 봤을 때는 틀린 거 아닌감??
아니면 일단 Wrong으로 해두고 나중에 운영팀한테 리크루팅 결과 전달할 때는 부분적으로 맞은 것도 함께 전달하는 것도 방법일듯
프로그래머스도 하나라도 틀리면 틀렸다고 뜨긴 함
이건 너가 먼저 머지하면 내가 컨플릭 해결해볼게
ㅇㅎ 좋은듯

음... 말로 하기가 어려운데... 억지로 pydantic의 from_orm 을 쓰려고 한 노력의 일환이랄까?...
그리고 저렇게 안 하면 쿼리를 끊어서 쏴야해서 하나의 쿼리로 해결하려다보니 저렇게 됨 ㅠ

부분점수 고려한다고 들었던거같아서?
난 갠적으로는 하나라도 틀리면 틀린게 맞다고 생각하긴함
으어어 이거 나도 고쳐야겠다 생각하긴 했는데... 서비스 로직으로 옮기려면 어떻게 해야하나 고민이네... 반영해보고 다시 코멘트 줄게

갓pt
87635d9

그것도 방법일거같고
아니면 함수를 example용/real용 두개로 나누는건 어때
problem도 ㅎㅎ

아 aggregation 한거구나
func.max가 너무 괴랄해보이는데 ㅋㅋ 저게 필요한 이유가 무야

나누는 건 좋아
근데 나누자는 게 repositories? servcies? views? 어떤 레이어에서 나누는 걸 생각한 거야?
ㅇㅎ 일단 틀렸다고 표시하고 부분점수 매긴다하면 그때 쿼리로 직접 뽑아주자 (기록 다 남으니께)
26dc04d

👍
근데 어디서는 Dto, 어디서는 Response/Request 쓰는데 그냥 직접적인 Response, Request 빼고는 다 Dto를 쓰기로 통일해버릴까?
후자가 더 이해하기 편할 듯!
좋지
근데 이게 enum으로 처리안 한 이유가.. 다른 애들은 DB에 저장될 건데 미제출 << 이 친구는 DB에 저장이 안 되거든? 근데 enum타입으로 선언하면 DB에 미제출이라는 값도 가능한 값의 목록 중 하나가 되니까 제외했던 건데.. 아니면 상속으로 해결할까? Enum은 상속이 안 되네 ㅋㅋ ㅠㅠ

service에서 나누는걸 생각했는데 그것도 나름대로 중복이 많아질듯..
그냥 차라리 디비에 저장을 하는건 어때?

status 0이 미제출이군..
Schema 레벨에서 enum을 하나 더 정의하는건?
documentation 차원에서도 enum을 쓰는게 좋을것같어
DB에 저장하는건 지금대로 CodeSubmissionStatus로 하고
스키마에 포함할건 ProblemStatus 같은걸로..
말 그대로 예제인데 디비에 저장하는 건 좀... 좀 더 고민해봄
그리고 지금 ResumeSubmission이 질문마다 하나씩 제출하도록 되어있어서 지원자수가 겁내 뻥튀기되네 ㄷㄷ 이것도 수정해서 올릴게
ㅋㅋㅋ애초에 Submission이라는 용어가 잘못된듯

화이팅
너무 애매하다 싶으면 시간 많이쓰지 말고 걍 냅둬도 ㄱㅊ
그럼 이건 나중에 리팩토링하는 걸로... ㅋㅋ 🥲
이건 왜 바뀐거야?

와 이게 이렇게 많았구나..
컴파일 에러 / 런타임 에러 / 시간제한 초과 정도는 유저 입장에서 알고싶을거같은데.. 이건 기획에 없나

모델에 @property 정의하면 depth 줄이고 가독성을 향상시킬 수 있지 않을까?
그리고 status = 0이 남아있는게 좀 아쉽구만
잉 이거 왜 바꿨지 실수인듯

이건 이미 구현되어 있어
보면 status가 object 고, 그 안에 id랑 description 이 들어감
class CodeSubmissionResult(BaseModel):
    num: int
    status: JudgeSubmissionStatusModel
    stdout: str | None
    time: Decimal | None
    memory: Decimal | None

...

class JudgeSubmissionStatusModel(BaseModel):
    id: JudgeSubmissionStatus
    description: str

아 status = 0 은 아직 고민 중이었음 ㅋㅋㅋ
너가 말한대로 따로 정의하는 것도 생각해봤는데 그럼 아래 로직을 버려야해서 ㅠ (별 문제는 아니다만)
status = problem.submissions[0].status.value
근데 property로 정의한다는 게 이 로직을 결국 persistence layer 로 옮긴다는 건데 그러면 dto에 정의하는 거랑 별반 차이 없는 거 아냐?? (근데 가독성 측면에서는 현재보다는 확실히 좋긴 할듯)

일단 반영함 (대신 problems relationship 이랑 겹치면 안 돼서 이름 좀 바꿈)
74f5cf8

node.title: fix some compilation warnings [-Wunused
node.body:
### Before PR on my local build:
[-Wunused-local-typedefs] 32
[-Wunused-variable] 40
[-Wunused-but-set-variable] 25
[-W 333

### After PR on my local build:
[-Wunused-local-typedefs] 32 👎 
[-Wunused-variable] 0 👍 
[-Wunused-but-set-variable] 10 👎 
[-W 276 (meaning 2 other random warnings disapeared in the process)

- Remaining [-Wunused-local-typedefs] all come from armadillo. FYI this has not been fixed in latest version 12.6.0 but I opened an issue and next release will work fine https://gitlab.com/conradsnicta/armadillo-code/-/issues/239 will be corrected in #53 as soon as Armadillo publish a release (usually 1-2 month)
- Remaining use_alpha set but not used [-Wunused-but-set-variable] => I believe this is a compiler bug: https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=96311 . Would probably be fixed if we upgrade compiler (for this we need to update QT).

nodes.bodyText:
Singletons:
There are many classes that should be a singleton that other classes need access to but were created by Mainwindow.  Eventually it became awkward to make each public in Mainwindow and then include Mainwindow.  It created circular includes.  Eventually I started making those singletons with the get instance.
Memory Leaks:
Yes I'm sure there are leaks and back in the days when Visual Studio was more affordable and I used MFC it had memory leak detection in the IDE.  When I switched to Qt that was no longer available and I have never found the method for Qt on windows  without Visual Studio to get leak detection.    I missed it greatly and forged ahead.
So any help there would be very good.  Also if one leaves DFTFringe running on a windows machine it eats up CPU usage.  Why?
Armadillo was once needed by Mike Pecks PSI and/or Zernike generation software.  I never actually implemented all of what I intended of Mike stuff.  So I have lost track of what of it was used.  I think there may have been some templated objects.  I'm likely never to do the original intention.

Dale thanks for the background information.
It didn't occur to me but of course you can do both: have singletons that have a "new" command in getInstance() and also instantiate all of those singletons in main() (and delete them upon exit).  In fact also checking for null in the getInstance() is potentially just a precaution.  So I have absolutely no issues with that way of doing things.
Not all singletons need to be instantiated in main but instead only the first time they are needed.  Thus the null check to keep them from being instantiated again.

In case you did not know there are books about useful software patterns that occur and are particular useful in object oriented languages.  Singleton is one such pattern.  That was very popular when I initially started writing OpenFinge and DFTFinge.  I don't know the state of "Patterns" these days in software engineering.

Dale, thanks for the background infos. This really helps.
About the singleton design pattern I simply want to share 2 infos:

Popularity of this pattern has decreased a lot. Now, this pattern should be avoided in most situations. I like this website but all recent ressources are agreeing on this point. https://isocpp.github.io/CppCoreGuidelines/CppCoreGuidelines#Ri-singleton
When using it, it should be updated to modern C++ (>=C++11). The new design pattern is still roughly the same but it is safer.

Standards are evolving, it doesn't mean the code is bad. I think it is important that we know it should be avoided but the changes would probably be quite complex. I would not see this change as high priority except if we start chasing memory leaks with Valgring or other tools.
I also had an interesting/long discussion with ChatGPT https://chat.openai.com/c/97c005b1-0940-4985-9978-076532dab7ad
But this is more for your information. I'm sure there are plenty of better ressources on the internet. No need to read it all. If you still read it, note that alternative approach 1 is probably the cleanest even if not the easiest.

DFTFringe's singletons are classes that contain mostly temporary state information that needs to be accessible to many different classes.  This data needs to remain around and stable as long as the app lives and then closing the app deletes it.  Since the deletes happen by the app close no specific delete is needed nor desired.  I would hope the leak detector understands that case.  IIRC the old Visual Studio leak detector did.
Each singleton is a manager of that data and can give clients views into it.  There can only be one manger for each related state data store.
In the old days of C they would have been global variables but are much better grouped by classes now I think.

node.bodyText:
I was unused if I should delete or only comment this...
I'm not used to Qt enough to understand what it does
Please double check if this one has a side effect.  I'm unsure with this new inside call and static member...

Dale has many classes that are only a single instance ever.  Only one object ever created of that class.  What he likes to do is give it a static function called "getInstance()" which grabs that single instance of the class.  The very very first time this function is called, the single instance is created.
Deleting this line of code is absolutely fine.

This was my understanding too but after discussing with my colleague so that they explain it to me.
It should probably not be done this way in 2023 but we did not have time to discuss it further.
It might probably be a global instance or an instance living in main(). getInstance() could still exist but there would be no memory leak (I agree there is no problematic leak here but there is still a new without free which is not OK).
Well this is just to share my though with you. This is not a priority fix and the details of how to do it cleanly are not clear for the moment.

This technique is used in many places and I think it's fine.  There are probably 10 or 20 classes with this function.  Classes that will only ever exist one time.
Then of course there are other classes like wavefront.  There are many of those.
Yes they could all be created in main() and deleted on program exit but not sure that matters.  I guess that would assist in checking for memory leaks as memory leak tools check to see what never gets deleted when the program is complete.
I just built the master branch and that is down to 267 warnings.  Progress!

I guess that would assist in checking for memory leaks as memory leak tools check to see what never gets deleted when the program is complete.

exactly.
I think it's fine.

Everything looks good.  All the code changes look fine.  But when I build this on my laptop (I usually build on my pc but I'm not at home now) I can't load igrams.
I don't know what's going on but I'll try building this on my pc tomorrow.
The instance built by "actions" works fine so I just have the wrong dll somewhere or something.
I was able to build and run no problem on my windows desktop.
